    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Balor (Fire Demon)</h1>When folk whisper frightened tales of the demonic, what most envision is the balor—a towering figure of fire and flesh, a horned nightmare armed with a flaming whip and a sword flying through the night in search of its latest victim. On the Abyss, balors serve demon lords as generals or captains, and they typically command vast legions of demons. Standing at 14 feet in height, only the cruelest mortal souls—those who devoted entire lives to sins too numerous to count—can fuel the formation of a balor. More often, a balor forms from a mass of dozens of mortal souls who shared debased ideologies in life. <h3 class="title">Balor Lords</h3> Those rare few balors who form from single souls are the ones most likely to eventually transcend the notable power they already wield, becoming a nascent demon lord. These balor lords are each unique creatures of 21st to 25th level in power who rule their own realm in the Abyss. In time, a balor lord can further develop into a unique creature with wildly different powers, even ascending to the role of a true demon lord.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 40<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=104">Balor</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 20</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Demon_Balor.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Demon_Balor.png"></a><span alt="Chaotic Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Evil">CE</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Demon Trait" class="trait" title="A family of fiends, demons hail from or trace their origins to the Abyss. Most are irredeemably chaotic evil and have darkvision."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=42">Demon</a></span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 83</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +36; darkvision, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=344"><i>true seeing</i></a><br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=12"><u>Abyssal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=16"><u>Celestial</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u>; telepathy 100 feet<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +35, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +37, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +36, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +32, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +38, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +32, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14"><u>Society</a></u> +32, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +33<br /><b>Str</b> +9, <b>Dex</b> +7, <b>Con</b> +9, <b>Int</b> +6, <b>Wis</b> +6, <b>Cha</b> +8<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=31"><u>longsword</u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 45, <b>Fort</b> +39, <b>Ref</b> +35, <b>Will</b> +34; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 480; <b>Immunities</b> fire; <b>Weaknesses</b> cold 20, cold iron 20, good 20<br /><b>Aura of Flame</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=65">evocation</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=72">fire</a>) 20 feet. A foe that starts its turn in the aura takes 3d6+10 fire damage, or 6d6+20 fire damage if the balor has grabbed or restrained it. A creature that hits a balor with an unarmed Strike takes 3d6+10 fire damage, and weapons that hit a balor take 3d6+10 fire damage.<br /> <b>Attack of Opportunity</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> The balor can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within their reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. They can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and they disrupt actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.<br /> <b>Death Throes</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=40">death</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=65">evocation</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=72">fire</a>) When a balor dies, their body explodes in a 100-foot aura of intense demonic flame. All creatures and objects in range take 16d10 fire damage (DC 45 basic Reflex save). Because the flame is infused with Abyssal energy, creatures in the area apply only half their usual fire resistance. Creatures with immunity to fire use an outcome one degree of success better than what they rolled, instead of gaining the usual benefit of immunity. The bodies of creatures reduced to 0 Hit Points by a balor’s death throes are completely incinerated into fine ash.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 35 feet, fly 70 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>vorpal cold iron silver longsword</i> +40 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile P</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 4d8+17 slashing plus 1d6 evil</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>cold iron silver flame whip</i> +40 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=175"><u>disarm</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=72"><u>fire</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 20 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=196"><u>trip</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 4d6+17 fire plus 1d6 evil, Improved Grab, and whip reposition</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 44; <b>10th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=82">divine decree</a></u></i> (x2); <b>8th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i> (at will); <b>6th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=87">dominate</a></u></i> (at will); <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i> (at will); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(10th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=334">telekinetic projectile</a></u></i>; <b>Constant</b> <b>(6th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=344">true seeing</a></u></i><br /><b>Divine Rituals</b> DC 44; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Rituals.aspx?ID=21">abyssal pact</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Dimensional Dervish</b> A balor can cast their 5th-level innate <i><a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></i> with only a single action.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Dispelling Strike</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction_I.png">  <b>Frequency</b> once per round. <b>Trigger</b> The balor hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a weapon Strike. <b>Effect</b> The balor casts an innate <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=78"><i>dispel magic</i></a> on the target of the triggering Strike.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Infuse Weapons</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>) Any weapon a balor wields becomes a <i>+3 <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=280">major striking</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=308">vorpal</a> weapon</i> made of cold iron and silver while the demon holds it. A weapon that isn’t eligible for the vorpal rune doesn’t gain its effects. The balor can change its evil damage to chaotic whenever it attacks. The demon can conjure a whip made of flames with an Interact action. This whip gains the same benefits as other weapons the balor wields.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Lifedrinker</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89"><u>healing</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) <b>Trigger</b> The balor kills a living creature that is at least 15th level. <b>Effect</b> The balor drinks the triggering creature’s life force and regains 10d8+80 Hit Points.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Whip Reposition</b> When a balor grabs a creature with a whip Strike, they can move the creature to any space in the whip’s reach. The balor can move without ending the grab as long as the creature remains within the whip’s reach, and the balor can move the creature to any other space in the whip’s reach with an Interact action.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=28">Demon</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=104">Balor (Fire Demon)</a></td><td>20</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=101">Glabrezu (Treachery Demon)</a></td><td>13</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=455">Kalavakus (Slaver Demon)</a></td><td>10</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=103">Marilith (Pride Demon)</a></td><td>17</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=481">Nalfeshnee (Boar Demon)</a></td><td>14</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=97">Quasit</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=102">Shemhazian (Mutilation Demon)</a></td><td>16</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=98">Succubus (Lust Demon)</a></td><td>7</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=100">Vrock (Wrath Demon)</a></td><td>9</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=28">Demon</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 76</i></a><br />When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Abyss, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more “specialized” depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon’s driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Abyss.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Demonic Deities</h3>The most powerful demons are known as demon lords (the term is gender neutral in this case). Of these divinities, Lamashtu is the most powerful. Countless other demon lords exist, including Abraxas, Cyth-V’sug, Kabriri, and Zura.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Demonic Locations</h3>The sprawling, heaving, changing realm of the Abyss is the planar home of demonic life, but demons can be found anywhere the capacity to sin exists. Evil or foolish conjurers are fond of calling upon demons for advice or darker needs. When the Abyss wears through the boundaries of reality to create wound-like portals into other worlds, demons can spill over to wreak incredible havoc.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Demonic Possession</h3>Some demons specialize in the art of possessing creatures or objects to spread fear and chaos. In such cases a demon gains a powerful disguise with which to work its evils upon the world, a subterfuge that delights the demon.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Demonic Sources</h3>When a sinful mortal soul is consigned to the Abyss, it spends time wallowing in the mire and feeding on filth. If it survives and is not itself eaten, the soul eventually ascends into a demon, as influenced by the nature of its sin, yet most demons are themselves capable of reproduction as well. The fecundity of demonic life is perhaps the greatest—and most threatening—aspect of these dangerous fiends.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Demons</h3>The Abyss may be the largest of the Outer Planes, and mortals have an equally large capacity to betray themselves, society, and the natural order of reality. With this limitless source for increasingly specialized sins, the Abyss is constantly generating new types of demons to plague reality. While the vast majority of these are swiftly destroyed and never rise again, enough survive that dozens, if not hundreds, of types of demons are known to exist beyond those listed here. The shadowy invidiak is a demon without a body, born of envious souls. The goat-faced, flame-hooved brimorak rises from the souls of arsonists. Slimy, horned blood demons spawn from assassins, boar demons from the greedy... the list goes on and on.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Sinful Destruction</h3>While they enjoy causing destruction themselves, most demons prefer to trick and tempt mortals into falling to sin of their own volition.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> The Nature of Chaos</h3>Some say that the nature of chaos inherently precludes cooperation and subtlety, but demons are proof of the fallacy of this claim.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> What Makes a Sin?</h3>Some classify sin into seven categories—envy, gluttony, greed, lust, pride, sloth, and wrath. While these sins embody some of the most powerful and numerous demons, far more than seven demons exist. Any act of cruelty or destruction a mortal takes to gratify the self at others’ expense is, in effect, a sin, and any such act can spawn a demon from a soul in the afterlife.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
